<!-- <![endif]-->
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
EVS
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/12/22/apple-make-cars?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Would You Buy an Apple Car?
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<img alt="An iPhone on wheels " style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC8zNTQwL2FwcGxlX2Nhci5qcGciLCJidWNrZXQiOiJvc2xvLXByb2R1Y3Rpb24iLCJlZGl0cyI6eyJyZXNpemUiOnsid2lkdGgiOjEwMDAsImhlaWdodCI6bnVsbH19fQ==">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Francis Scialabba</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">On Monday, Reuters <a href="https://www.reuters.com/article/us-apple-autos-exclusive/exclusive-apple-targets-car-production-by-2024-and-eyes-next-level-battery-technology-sources-idUSKBN28V2PY?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">reported</a> that Apple's self-driving car unit, in the shadows for years, is revving up to produce an electric passenger vehicle by 2024. The Silicon Valley colossus reportedly plans to implement innovative new battery tech to maximize range and minimize cost. </p>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">The takes were swift and they were hot</h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">The bears </strong>were perhaps best summed up by Barron’s Senior Writer Al Root, who <a href="https://www.barrons.com/articles/apple-icar-is-a-terrible-idea-heres-why-51608652633?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">wrote</a>, "making cars is hard." The iCar haters say no amount of sleek minimalism can make up for the vast capital and manufacturing capacity it takes to churn out automobiles.</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>It took 17 years for Tesla to turn a profit making cars. </span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Skeptics of the move also pointed to the lower profit margins and valuations in the auto industry compared to tech. </span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Root suggested it would be wiser for Apple to pursue the route Alphabet's Waymo has taken: developing self-driving tech to sell to automakers. Apple hasn't ruled out that approach. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">The bulls </strong>argue that while auto manufacturing takes a lot of cash, Apple is the rare company that has...a lot of cash (<a href="https://www.cnbc.com/2020/10/29/apple-q4-cash-hoard-heres-how-much-apple-has-on-hand.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">$192 billion</a> at last count). Also, Apple investors are used to eye-popping growth—to keep its stock price on a roll, Apple <a href="https://www.barrons.com/articles/2-trillion-reasons-why-the-apple-icar-rumors-will-never-go-away-51608668648?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">needs to pursue</a> new markets.  </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>As for manufacturing logistics, Apple has managed to reliably move its products from factories to consumers, the bulls </span><span><a href="https://www.bloomberg.com/opinion/articles/2020-12-22/apple-tesla-showdown-over-self-driving-cars-will-happen-on-factory-floor?sref=KkPzpZvz&utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">say</a></span><span>, while Tesla hasn't always checked that box. </span>
</li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Plus...you know you want to see what that design team comes up with. </span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Zoom out: </strong>While we don't have a final verdict on the Apple car, we know it would be a challenge to Tesla. The EV maker's shares slid in its first two days in the S&P 500 index, and Morgan Stanley analysts <a href="https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2020-12-22/apple-s-car-plan-creates-tesla-bear-case-morgan-stanley-says?srnd=premium&sref=KkPzpZvz&utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">wrote</a> that the news of Apple's entry was "perhaps the most credible/formidable bear case for Tesla's stock that investors have had to consider for some time." </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Tesla CEO Elon Musk seems ready for a fight. He <a href="https://twitter.com/elonmusk/status/1341485211209637889?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">tweeted</a> yesterday that when the Model 3 was floundering, he approached Apple CEO Tim Cook about an acquisition at about 10% of Tesla’s current price. Cook “refused to take the meeting,” Musk said.</p>

<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
STIMULUS
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/12/23/president-trump-criticizes-stimulus-package-twitter-video?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Watching Trump's Video on the Stimulus Bill Like
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<img alt="Mr. Krabs" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC8xMjQxL21yX2tyYWJzLnBuZyIsImJ1Y2tldCI6Im9zbG8tcHJvZHVjdGlvbiIsImVkaXRzIjp7InJlc2l6ZSI6eyJ3aWR0aCI6MTAwMCwiaGVpZ2h0IjpudWxsfX19">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Know Your Meme</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Last night, in a video posted to Twitter, President Trump <a href="https://apnews.com/article/donald-trump-legislation-coronavirus-pandemic-latin-america-91cceebf9d788d4525ffb85fadb2b151?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">criticized</a> the $900 billion relief package Congress passed on Monday, calling it a “disgrace” and saying it has “almost nothing to do with Covid.” It wasn’t clear whether he would sign it. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Trump’s opposition was a complete surprise. The president had stayed on the sidelines of negotiations as a bipartisan group of lawmakers compromised on a bill that would provide relief to Americans and businesses suffering from the pandemic.  </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>The highlights of the package were more than $300 billion for small businesses, direct payments of up to $600 for individual Americans, and added unemployment insurance until mid-March.</span></li>
</ul>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">That wasn’t enough for Trump </h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">The president said, “I am asking Congress to amend this bill and increase the ridiculously low $600 to $2,000, or $4,000 for a couple.” </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Democrats...don’t hate it. Having fought for a more generous bill in the first place, House Speaker Nancy Pelosi tweeted, “Democrats are ready to bring this to the Floor this week by unanimous consent. Let’s do it!” A vote on $2,000 checks could come Thursday.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Zoom out: </strong>We don’t know yet whether President Trump will derail the bill. Aides <a href="https://www.wsj.com/articles/trump-asks-congress-to-amend-covid-19-package-boost-direct-payments-11608684702?mod=hp_lead_pos7&utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">told the WSJ</a> this statement was more Trump celebrating Festivus one day early by airing his grievances, rather than a legitimate threat to block the stimulus package. </p>

<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
MISC
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/12/22/news-numbers-vaccines-icu-capacity-consumer-confidence?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Significant Digits
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<img alt="An illustration of the Earth on a turquoise background with two needles filled with a red serum (symbolizing vaccines) injecting it from either side" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC8zMTUwL2NvdmlkLTE5X3ZhY2NpbmUuanBnIiwiYnVja2V0Ijoib3Nsby1wcm9kdWN0aW9uIiwiZWRpdHMiOnsicmVzaXplIjp7IndpZHRoIjoxMDAwLCJoZWlnaHQiOm51bGx9fX0=">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Francis Scialabba</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Did you spend yesterday afternoon sneaking in one last batch of Christmas cookies instead of answering emails? Let's catch you up on the most important numbers from the news. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">2.2+ million: </strong>The number of people globally who have <a href="https://www.bloomberg.com/graphics/covid-vaccine-tracker-global-distribution/?srnd=premium&sref=KkPzpZvz&utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">been vaccinated</a> against Covid-19, per Bloomberg estimates. In the U.S., we're at 614k and counting. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">115,000+: </strong>Americans currently hospitalized with the coronavirus. Covid patients are <a href="https://www.nytimes.com/interactive/2020/us/covid-hospitals-near-you.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">straining healthcare systems</a> across the country, and almost one-fifth of hospitals with ICUs have filled 95% of beds. </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>
</span><span><strong style="color:#000">0%: </strong></span><span><a href="https://www.ocregister.com/2020/12/18/what-public-health-leaders-mean-by-0-icu-beds-available/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">ICU capacity</a></span><span> in SoCal. The U.S.' most populous state could add 300,000 new cases this week, and some projections say it's headed to 90,000 hospitalizations. </span>
</li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">88.6:</strong> The December reading of U.S. consumer confidence, which <a href="https://apnews.com/article/coronavirus-pandemic-consumer-confidence-63252732deb61035e2d7e513a536c1ea?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">fell sharply</a> from November. It's a sign of consumer pessimism during what is a crucial season for retailers, airlines, and restaurants. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">-2.5%: </strong>The <a href="https://apnews.com/article/charlotte-coronavirus-pandemic-home-sales-7f0544abc00a14cf2e55acc09dcf79dc?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">change</a> in existing home sales in November, the first monthly dip since May. Sales are still up over 25% annually, and average home prices have gained nearly 15%. </p>

<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">With the holidays literally knocking at your holly, jolly, wreathed door, it’s time to take a moment and think about what you can get yourself this year.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><a href="https://ad.doubleclick.net/ddm/trackclk/N2992.3407870MORNINGBREW/B23591364.287405807;dc_trk_aid=483189083;dc_trk_cid=100857211;dc_lat=;dc_rdid=;tag_for_child_directed_treatment=;tfua=;gdpr=%24{GDPR};gdpr_consent=%24{GDPR_CONSENT_755}" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Vanguard Digital Advisor</a>® is making that decision a little easier by <strong style="color:#000">waiving advisory fees for 90 days</strong> when you enroll before 12/31/2020.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">As we’ve told you before, <strong style="color:#000">Digital Advisor helps you design your unique retirement savings plan with its sophisticated retirement calculator</strong>.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">And with Vanguard’s 45+ years of investing expertise backing everything they do, they can tailor an investing strategy that can help you reach your goals.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">So make this the holiday you think about your future. </p>

<!-- <![endif]-->
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
SHIPPING
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/12/22/usps-hit-triple-whammy-challenges-ahead-holidays?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Postal Service Burdened by Such Great Heights
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<img alt="USPS mail boxes" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC81NjIvdXNwc19tYWlsX2JveGVzLmpwZyIsImJ1Y2tldCI6Im9zbG8tcHJvZHVjdGlvbiIsImVkaXRzIjp7InJlc2l6ZSI6eyJ3aWR0aCI6MTAwMCwiaGVpZ2h0IjpudWxsfX19">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Wallpaper Flare</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">This story is dedicated to all readers crippled with fear because your girlfriend's present hasn't left the warehouse in Kentucky yet. You are not alone: USPS is struggling to keep up with deliveries ahead of Christmas. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">The key number: </strong>Foot traffic <a href="https://www.wsj.com/articles/u-s-postal-service-struggles-to-keep-up-with-christmas-deliveries-11608647815?mod=hp_lista_pos3&utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">fell 39%</a> annually at U.S. retail stores on "Super Saturday," aka the Saturday before Christmas. That doesn't mean people are buying fewer gifts...it means they're buying them online, putting further strain on an already strained delivery system.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">On top of the e-commerce surge, the USPS is facing a double whammy of other challenges: </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>FedEx and UPS limited shipments from some retailers earlier this month. USPS has been picking up the slack and handling an average of 6 million extra packages per day. </span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>At the same time, its workforce has shrunk due to Covid. Almost 19,000 of USPS's 644,000 employees have called in sick or are isolating because of the coronavirus. </span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Truth: </strong>"This year can't end fast enough," Jennifer Lemke, the clerk craft director at APWU Local 170 in Ohio, <a href="https://www.washingtonpost.com/business/2020/12/21/usps-delays-christmas/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">told the Washington Post</a>.</p>

<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding-top: 12px;">

<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">

<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">

<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
AGRICULTURE
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/12/22/christmas-tree-supply-run-short-pandemic?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
That'll Be $375
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>

<!--[if mso]>
<img alt="A gif of Charlie Brown holding up a puny Christmas tree with one ornament; the caption "It's not bad at all, really. Maybe it just needs a little love" is written across the bottom" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" height=505 src="https://media.giphy.com/media/1246jjAs7b1Fvi/giphy.gif">
<![endif]-->
<!--[if !mso]>--><!-- -->
<img class="story-header-image" alt="A gif of Charlie Brown holding up a puny Christmas tree with one ornament; the caption " It's not bad at all, really. Maybe it just needs a little love" is written across the bottom" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" src="https://media.giphy.com/media/1246jjAs7b1Fvi/giphy.gif">
<!--<![endif]-->
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Giphy</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Looking to stave off the Covid holiday blues, millions of Americans are making space in their home for a bushy balsam fir. But this year, they may have had trouble finding the perfect one. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Christmas tree grower associations <a href="https://www.nytimes.com/2020/12/06/us/christmas-tree-sales-boom.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">have reported</a> that earlier purchases and increased sales this year are sapping inventory (the National Christmas Tree Association says it's <em>not</em> a shortage, just a tight supply).  </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>In Hong Kong and Singapore, customers </span><span><a href="https://www.wsj.com/articles/how-tight-is-the-christmas-tree-supply-an-8-footer-can-sell-for-2-000-11607884307?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">have queued up</a></span><span> for hours to get one, and 6' trees are selling for $1,500 a pop—around 8x last year's prices. </span>
</li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>"Knee-high bundles of branches shaped like trees are going for $100 apiece," the WSJ reports. </span></li>
</ul>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">One explanation: the recession</h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">But not the one fresh on your mind. After the 2008 financial crisis, trees were plentiful and prices fell, so some farmers <a href="https://www.npr.org/2020/12/11/945606413/we-buy-a-lot-of-christmas-trees?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">planted fewer trees</a>. Because a Christmas tree typically takes 8–12 years to mature, those reduced plantings = today's supply crunch. </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>The accompanying price increase has been a rare boon for farmers. One Oregon farm estimates a 30% rise in tree prices over the last four years.</span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">+ While we're here: </strong>Wirecutter's <a href="https://www.nytimes.com/wirecutter/reviews/best-artificial-christmas-tree/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">recommendations</a> for the best artificial holiday trees. </p>

<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Plus after plus</strong>. <a href="https://goto.walmart.com/c/2578951/897011/9383?sourceid=imp_000011112222333344&u=www.walmart.com%2Fplus%3Fcn%3DFY21-wpl-content-aff-gen-fs&veh=aff&sharedid=morningbrew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Walmart+</a> is a new kind of membership that saves you time and money. Keep reading for more on that.\u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003e\n\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003ePardons: \u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003cspan\u003ePresident Trump \u003c/span\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://apnews.com/article/donald-trump-campaigns-duncan-hunter-russia-87bf992ea9bece8eee58ac8ecf1f1bd6?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003epardoned 15 people\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003cspan\u003e, including former campaign aide George Papadopoulos and former Rep. Chris Collins, who pleaded guilty to charges of conspiring to commit securities fraud.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\n\u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\n\u003c/td\u003e\n\u003c/tr\u003e\n\u003c/table\u003e\n\u003c/th\u003e\n\u003c/tr\u003e\n\u003c/table\u003e\n\u003c!--[if !mso ]\u003e\u003c! -- --\u003e\n\u003c/div\u003e\n\u003c/div\u003e\n\u003c!-- \u003c![endif]--\u003e\n\u003c!-- END MARKETS --\u003e\n\u003c!-- ARTICLE ---\u003e\n\u003c!--[if !mso ]\u003e\u003c! -- --\u003e\n\u003cdiv class=\"c6 \" style=\"margin-bottom:7px\"\u003e\n\u003c!-- \u003c![endif]--\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003cth class=\"card\" style=\"text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px\"\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding: 15px;\"\u003e\n\u003ch3 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0\"\u003e\nEVS \n\u003c/h3\u003e\n\u003ch1 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px\"\u003e\n\u003ca href=\"https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/12/22/apple-make-cars?email={{profile.email}}\" target=\"_blank\" style=\"color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;\"\u003e\n\u003cfont color=\"#000000\"\u003e\nWould You Buy an Apple Car?\n\u003c/font\u003e\u003c/a\u003e\n\u003c/h1\u003e\n\u003c/td\u003e\n\u003c/tr\u003e\n\u003c/table\u003e\n\u003cimg alt=\"An iPhone on wheels \" style=\"display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;\" width=\"670\" class=\"story-header-image\" src=\"https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC8zNTQwL2FwcGxlX2Nhci5qcGciLCJidWNrZXQiOiJvc2xvLXByb2R1Y3Rpb24iLCJlZGl0cyI6eyJyZXNpemUiOnsid2lkdGgiOjEwMDAsImhlaWdodCI6bnVsbH19fQ==\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;\"\u003e\n\u003csmall\u003e\u003cem\u003eFrancis Scialabba\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/small\u003e\n\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding:15px\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eOn Monday, Reuters \u003ca href=\"https://www.reuters.com/article/us-apple-autos-exclusive/exclusive-apple-targets-car-production-by-2024-and-eyes-next-level-battery-technology-sources-idUSKBN28V2PY?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ereported\u003c/a\u003e that Apple's self-driving car unit, in the shadows for years, is revving up to produce an electric passenger vehicle by 2024. The Silicon Valley colossus reportedly plans to implement innovative new battery tech to maximize range and minimize cost. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003ch2 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0\"\u003eThe takes were swift and they were hot\u003c/h2\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eThe bears \u003c/strong\u003ewere perhaps best summed up by Barron’s Senior Writer Al Root, who \u003ca href=\"https://www.barrons.com/articles/apple-icar-is-a-terrible-idea-heres-why-51608652633?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ewrote\u003c/a\u003e, \"making cars is hard.\" The iCar haters say no amount of sleek minimalism can make up for the vast capital and manufacturing capacity it takes to churn out automobiles.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eIt took 17 years for Tesla to turn a profit making cars. \u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eSkeptics of the move also pointed to the lower profit margins and valuations in the auto industry compared to tech. \u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eRoot suggested it would be wiser for Apple to pursue the route Alphabet's Waymo has taken: developing self-driving tech to sell to automakers. Apple hasn't ruled out that approach. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eThe bulls \u003c/strong\u003eargue that while auto manufacturing takes a lot of cash, Apple is the rare company that has...a lot of cash (\u003ca href=\"https://www.cnbc.com/2020/10/29/apple-q4-cash-hoard-heres-how-much-apple-has-on-hand.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003e$192 billion\u003c/a\u003e at last count). Also, Apple investors are used to eye-popping growth—to keep its stock price on a roll, Apple \u003ca href=\"https://www.barrons.com/articles/2-trillion-reasons-why-the-apple-icar-rumors-will-never-go-away-51608668648?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eneeds to pursue\u003c/a\u003e new markets.  \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003eAs for manufacturing logistics, Apple has managed to reliably move its products from factories to consumers, the bulls \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.bloomberg.com/opinion/articles/2020-12-22/apple-tesla-showdown-over-self-driving-cars-will-happen-on-factory-floor?sref=KkPzpZvz\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003esay\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e, while Tesla hasn't always checked that box. \u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003ePlus...you know you want to see what that design team comes up with. \u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eZoom out: \u003c/strong\u003eWhile we don't have a final verdict on the Apple car, we know it would be a challenge to Tesla. The EV maker's shares slid in its first two days in the S\u0026P 500 index, and Morgan Stanley analysts \u003ca href=\"https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2020-12-22/apple-s-car-plan-creates-tesla-bear-case-morgan-stanley-says?srnd=premium\u0026sref=KkPzpZvz\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ewrote\u003c/a\u003e that the news of Apple's entry was \"perhaps the most credible/formidable bear case for Tesla's stock that investors have had to consider for some time.\" \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eTesla CEO Elon Musk seems ready for a fight. He \u003ca href=\"https://twitter.com/elonmusk/status/1341485211209637889?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003etweeted\u003c/a\u003e yesterday that when the Model 3 was floundering, he approached Apple CEO Tim Cook about an acquisition at about 10% of Tesla’s current price. Cook “refused to take the meeting,” Musk said.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c!-- SOCIAL LINKS --\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: Meme\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/small\u003e\n\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding:15px\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eLast night, in a video posted to Twitter, President Trump \u003ca href=\"https://apnews.com/article/donald-trump-legislation-coronavirus-pandemic-latin-america-91cceebf9d788d4525ffb85fadb2b151?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ecriticized\u003c/a\u003e the $900 billion relief package Congress passed on Monday, calling it a “disgrace” and saying it has “almost nothing to do with Covid.” It wasn’t clear whether he would sign it. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eTrump’s opposition was a complete surprise. The president had stayed on the sidelines of negotiations as a bipartisan group of lawmakers compromised on a bill that would provide relief to Americans and businesses suffering from the pandemic.  \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eThe highlights of the package were more than $300 billion for small businesses, direct payments of up to $600 for individual Americans, and added unemployment insurance until mid-March.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003ch2 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0\"\u003eThat wasn’t enough for Trump \u003c/h2\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eThe president said, “I am asking Congress to amend this bill and increase the ridiculously low $600 to $2,000, or $4,000 for a couple.” \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eDemocrats...don’t hate it. Having fought for a more generous bill in the first place, House Speaker Nancy Pelosi tweeted, “Democrats are ready to bring this to the Floor this week by unanimous consent. Let’s do it!” A vote on $2,000 checks could come Thursday.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eZoom out: \u003c/strong\u003eWe don’t know yet whether President Trump will derail the bill. Aides \u003ca href=\"https://www.wsj.com/articles/trump-asks-congress-to-amend-covid-19-package-boost-direct-payments-11608684702?mod=hp_lead_pos7\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003etold the WSJ\u003c/a\u003e this statement was more Trump celebrating Festivus one day early by airing his grievances, rather than a legitimate threat to block the stimulus package. \u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c!-- SOCIAL LINKS --\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding:15px\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eDid you spend yesterday afternoon sneaking in one last batch of Christmas cookies instead of answering emails? Let's catch you up on the most important numbers from the news. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003e2.2+ million: \u003c/strong\u003eThe number of people globally who have \u003ca href=\"https://www.bloomberg.com/graphics/covid-vaccine-tracker-global-distribution/?srnd=premium\u0026sref=KkPzpZvz\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ebeen vaccinated\u003c/a\u003e against Covid-19, per Bloomberg estimates. In the U.S., we're at 614k and counting. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003e115,000+: \u003c/strong\u003eAmericans currently hospitalized with the coronavirus. Covid patients are \u003ca href=\"https://www.nytimes.com/interactive/2020/us/covid-hospitals-near-you.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003estraining healthcare systems\u003c/a\u003e across the country, and almost one-fifth of hospitals with ICUs have filled 95% of beds. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003e\n\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003e0%: \u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.ocregister.com/2020/12/18/what-public-health-leaders-mean-by-0-icu-beds-available/?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eICU capacity\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e in SoCal. The U.S.' most populous state could add 300,000 new cases this week, and some projections say it's headed to 90,000 hospitalizations. \u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003e88.6:\u003c/strong\u003e The December reading of U.S. consumer confidence, which \u003ca href=\"https://apnews.com/article/coronavirus-pandemic-consumer-confidence-63252732deb61035e2d7e513a536c1ea?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003efell sharply\u003c/a\u003e from November. It's a sign of consumer pessimism during what is a crucial season for retailers, airlines, and restaurants. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003e-2.5%: \u003c/strong\u003eThe \u003ca href=\"https://apnews.com/article/charlotte-coronavirus-pandemic-home-sales-7f0544abc00a14cf2e55acc09dcf79dc?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003echange\u003c/a\u003e in existing home sales in November, the first monthly dip since May. style=\"padding:15px\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eThis story is dedicated to all readers crippled with fear because your girlfriend's present hasn't left the warehouse in Kentucky yet. You are not alone: USPS is struggling to keep up with deliveries ahead of Christmas. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eThe key number: \u003c/strong\u003eFoot traffic \u003ca href=\"https://www.wsj.com/articles/u-s-postal-service-struggles-to-keep-up-with-christmas-deliveries-11608647815?mod=hp_lista_pos3\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003efell 39%\u003c/a\u003e annually at U.S. retail stores on \"Super Saturday,\" aka the Saturday before Christmas. That doesn't mean people are buying fewer gifts...it means they're buying them online, putting further strain on an already strained delivery system.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eOn top of the e-commerce surge, the USPS is facing a double whammy of other challenges: \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eFedEx and UPS limited shipments from some retailers earlier this month. USPS has been picking up the slack and handling an average of 6 million extra packages per day. \u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eAt the same time, its workforce has shrunk due to Covid. Almost 19,000 of USPS's 644,000 employees have called in sick or are isolating because of the coronavirus. \u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eTruth: \u003c/strong\u003e\"This year can't end fast enough,\" Jennifer Lemke, the clerk craft director at APWU Local 170 in Ohio, \u003ca href=\"https://www.washingtonpost.com/business/2020/12/21/usps-delays-christmas/?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003etold the Washington Post\u003c/a\u003e.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c!-- SOCIAL LINKS --\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" But this year, they may have had trouble finding the perfect one. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eChristmas tree grower associations \u003ca href=\"https://www.nytimes.com/2020/12/06/us/christmas-tree-sales-boom.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ehave reported\u003c/a\u003e that earlier purchases and increased sales this year are sapping inventory (the National Christmas Tree Association says it's \u003cem\u003enot\u003c/em\u003e a shortage, just a tight supply).  \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003eIn Hong Kong and Singapore, customers \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.wsj.com/articles/how-tight-is-the-christmas-tree-supply-an-8-footer-can-sell-for-2-000-11607884307?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ehave queued up\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e for hours to get one, and 6' trees are selling for $1,500 a pop—around 8x last year's prices. \u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\"Knee-high bundles of branches shaped like trees are going for $100 apiece,\" the WSJ reports. \u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003ch2 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0\"\u003eOne explanation: the recession\u003c/h2\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eBut not the one fresh on your mind. After the 2008 financial crisis, trees were plentiful and prices fell, so some farmers \u003ca href=\"https://www.npr.org/2020/12/11/945606413/we-buy-a-lot-of-christmas-trees?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eplanted fewer trees\u003c/a\u003e. Because a Christmas tree typically takes 8–12 years to mature, those reduced plantings = today's supply crunch. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eThe accompanying price increase has been a rare boon for farmers. One Oregon farm estimates a 30% rise in tree prices over the last four years.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003e+ While we're here: \u003c/strong\u003eWirecutter's \u003ca href=\"https://www.nytimes.com/wirecutter/reviews/best-artificial-christmas-tree/?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003erecommendations\u003c/a\u003e for the best artificial holiday trees. \u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c!-- SOCIAL LINKS --\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\"
